full_text: Log in as Superuser. Click Administration. The tree structure will always show the home organization of the user, either internal or external. Search for an organization using the links under Users & Security. Enter the search criteria. Click Search. The search results are displayed as links. Clicking on the links to the search criteria. Click Search. Click for Armstrong and Company to view the details. The Basics tab displays the organization info, such as, name, type, address, supervisor, etc. The Users tab lists users under that organization. The Producer Codes tab displays the list of producer codes with the description, status, branch and the preferred underwriter for each code. The Queues tab lists the queues used for activity assignment. The Regents tab lists the queues used for activity assignment. The Regents tab lists the regions that the system can use when making assignment decisions. A new organization can be created using the Actions menu. We will not go into details for this action. Next, we will look at how to manage Producer Codes. Click on the Producer Code link for Armstrong Premier. The Basics tab displays the code, description, organization, status and other information related to the Producer Code. The Roles tab lists the regions that the system can use when making assignment decisions. The Roles tab lists the roles added to the Producer Code. The Groups tab lists the groups that have this Producer Code, in View-only mode. The Users tab lists the users that have access to this Producer Code, in View-only mode. To search for a Producer Code, go to the Producer Codes page under Users & Security. Enter Search criteria and click Search. Create a new Producer Code from the Actions menu. Select New Producer Code. The Code field must be unique. The new code belongs to Armstrong and Company. Click the Search icon to find the organization. Enter the name. Click Search. Select Armstrong and Company. Enter a description. It is optional to select a preferred underwriter for underwriter assignment purpose. Go to the Roles tab. Add the Producer role. Click Update to save the new Producer Code. If multiple languages are turned on, a warning message about localization is displayed. Click Update again to save. The new Producer Code must be made available to the users in any group. Click on the Organization link. Go to the Producer Codes tab to review the codes for the organization. Go to the Group for Foster City Producers. Click the Producer Codes tab for the group. It displays all the Producer Codes from its parent, the organization. Click Edit. Set a Producer Code to be available for the current group by clicking the checkbox. Click Update to save the change. Go to the Users tab. Click the link for the user Mary Armstrong in the group. Go to the Access tab. Verify that the Producer Code is displayed under Producer Codes from group. Additional Producer Codes can be added by editing the user. Click Add in the Additional Producer Codes section. Search for the Producer Codes. Select the Producer Code to add to the user. Save the changes. This is the end of the demonstration for managing organizations and Producer Codes.  !

segments.text: Log in as Superuser. Click Administration. The tree structure will always show the home organization of the user, either internal or external. Search for an organization using the links under Users & Security. Enter the search criteria. Click Search. The search results are displayed as links. Clicking on the links to the search criteria. Click Search.

Click for Armstrong and Company to view the details. The Basics tab displays the organization info, such as, name, type, address, supervisor, etc. The Users tab lists users under that organization. The Producer Codes tab displays the list of producer codes with the description, status, branch and the preferred underwriter for each code. The Queues tab lists the queues used for activity assignment. The Regents tab lists the queues used for activity assignment.

The Regents tab lists the regions that the system can use when making assignment decisions. A new organization can be created using the Actions menu. We will not go into details for this action. Next, we will look at how to manage Producer Codes. Click on the Producer Code link for Armstrong Premier. The Basics tab displays the code, description, organization, status and other information related to the Producer Code. The Roles tab lists the regions that the system can use when making assignment decisions.

The Roles tab lists the roles added to the Producer Code. The Groups tab lists the groups that have this Producer Code, in View-only mode. The Users tab lists the users that have access to this Producer Code, in View-only mode. To search for a Producer Code, go to the Producer Codes page under Users & Security. Enter Search criteria and click Search.

Create a new Producer Code from the Actions menu. Select New Producer Code. The Code field must be unique. The new code belongs to Armstrong and Company. Click the Search icon to find the organization. Enter the name. Click Search.
Select Armstrong and Company. Enter a description.
It is optional to select a preferred underwriter for underwriter assignment purpose. Go to the Roles tab. Add the Producer role.
Click Update to save the new Producer Code. If multiple languages are turned on, a warning message about localization is displayed. Click Update again to save.
The new Producer Code must be made available to the users in any group. Click on the Organization link.
Go to the Producer Codes tab to review the codes for the organization. Go to the Group for Foster City Producers. Click the Producer Codes tab for the group.
It displays all the Producer Codes from its parent, the organization. Click Edit.
Set a Producer Code to be available for the current group by clicking the checkbox. Click Update to save the change.
Click the link for the user Mary Armstrong in the group. Go to the Access tab.
Verify that the Producer Code is displayed under Producer Codes from group. Additional Producer Codes can be added by editing the user. Click Add in the Additional Producer Codes section.
Search for the Producer Codes. Select the Producer Code to add to the user.
This is the end of the demonstration for managing organizations and Producer Codes.
